element.definition: An ingredient of a manufactured item or pharmaceutical product.
element.short: An ingredient of a manufactured item or pharmaceutical product

element.definition: The identifier(s) of this Ingredient that are assigned by business processes and/or used to refer to it when a direct URL reference to the resource itself is not appropriate.
element.short: An identifier or code by which the ingredient can be referenced

element.definition: A classification of the ingredient identifying its purpose within the product, e.g. active, inactive.
element.short: A classification of the ingredient identifying its purpose within the product, e.g. active, inactive

element.definition: A classification of the ingredient identifying its precise purpose(s) in the drug product. This extends the Ingredient.role to add more detail. Example: Antioxidant, Alkalizing Agent.
element.short: A classification of the ingredient identifying its precise purpose(s) in the drug product. This extends the Ingredient.role to add more detail. Example: Antioxidant, Alkalizing Agent

element.definition: A general description of the ingredient, or any supporting text. May be used for an unstructured list of excipients.
element.short: A general description of the ingredient, or any supporting text. May be used for an unstructured list of excipients

element.definition: If the ingredient is a known or suspected allergen.
element.short: If the ingredient is a known or suspected allergen

element.definition: The organization that manufactures this ingredient.
element.short: The organization that manufactures this ingredient

element.definition: The substance that comprises this ingredient.
element.short: The substance that comprises this ingredient

element.definition: A code or full resource that represents the ingredient substance.
element.short: A code or full resource that represents the ingredient substance

element.definition: The quantity of substance in the unit of presentation, or in the volume (or mass) of the single pharmaceutical product or manufactured item. When there is a range of strengths, this represents the lower limit.
element.short: The quantity of substance in the unit of presentation, or in the volume (or mass) of the single pharmaceutical product or manufactured item. When there is a range of strengths, this represents the lower limit

element.definition: The quantity of substance in the unit of presentation, or in the volume (or mass) of the single pharmaceutical product or manufactured item.
element.short: The quantity of substance in the unit of presentation, or in the volume (or mass) of the single pharmaceutical product or manufactured item

element.definition: An upper limit for the quantity of substance in the unit of presentation. When there is a range of strengths, this represents the upper limit.
element.isModifierReason: If this is present it implies that the whole strength is expressed as a range, due to uncertainty or variation
element.short: An upper limit for the quantity of substance in the unit of presentation. When there is a range of strengths, this represents the upper limit

element.definition: A textual represention of either the whole of the presentation strength or a part of it - with the rest being in Strength.presentation as a ratio.
element.short: A textual represention of either the whole of the presentation strength or a part of it - with the rest being in Strength.presentation as a ratio

element.definition: The strength per unitary volume (or mass).
element.short: The strength per unitary volume (or mass)

element.definition: An upper limit for the strength per unitary volume (or mass), for when there is a range. The concentration attribute then becomes the lower limit.
element.isModifierReason: If this is present it implies that the whole strength is expressed as a range, due to uncertainty or variation
element.short: An upper limit for the strength per unitary volume (or mass), for when there is a range. The concentration attribute then becomes the lower limit

element.definition: A textual represention of either the whole of the concentration strength or a part of it - with the rest being in Strength.concentration as a ratio.
element.short: A textual represention of either the whole of the concentration strength or a part of it - with the rest being in Strength.concentration as a ratio

element.definition: For when strength is measured at a particular point or distance.
element.short: For when strength is measured at a particular point or distance

element.definition: The country or countries for which the strength range applies.
element.short: The country or countries for which the strength range applies

element.definition: Strength expressed in terms of a reference substance.
element.short: Strength expressed in terms of a reference substance

element.definition: Relevant reference substance.
element.short: Relevant reference substance

element.definition: Strength expressed in terms of a reference substance. When there is a range of strengths, this represents the lower limit.
element.short: Strength expressed in terms of a reference substance. When there is a range of strengths, this represents the lower limit

element.definition: Strength expressed in terms of a reference substance. When there is a range of strengths, this represents the upper limit.
element.short: Strength expressed in terms of a reference substance. When there is a range of strengths, this represents the upper limit

element.definition: For when strength is measured at a particular point or distance.
element.short: For when strength is measured at a particular point or distance

element.definition: The country or countries for which the strength range applies.
element.short: The country or countries for which the strength range applies

element.definition: A specified substance that comprises this ingredient.
element.short: A specified substance that comprises this ingredient

element.definition: Substance as a 'specified substance', implying extra substance related characteristics.
element.short: Substance as a 'specified substance', implying extra substance related characteristics

element.definition:
The group of specified substance, e.g. group 1 to 4, where the group categorises the level of 
description of the substance according to standardised sets of properties.
element.short:
The group of specified substance, e.g. group 1 to 4, where the group categorises the level of 
description of the substance according to standardised sets of properties

element.definition: Confidentiality level of the specified substance as the ingredient.
element.short: Confidentiality level of the specified substance as the ingredient

element.definition: Quantity of the substance or specified substance present in the manufactured item or pharmaceutical product.
element.short: Quantity of the substance or specified substance present in the manufactured item or pharmaceutical product

name: Ingredient
publisher: Health Level Seven International (Biomedical Research and Regulation)

constraint.human: If the resource is contained in another resource, it SHALL NOT contain nested Resources

constraint.expression: contained.where(((id.exists() and ('#'+id in (%resource.descendants().reference | %resource.descendants().as(canonical) | %resource.descendants().as(uri) | %resource.descendants().as(url)))) or descendants().where(reference = '#').exists() or descendants().where(as(canonical) = '#').exists() or descendants().where(as(uri) = '#').exists()).not()).trace('unmatched', id).empty()
constraint.human: If the resource is contained in another resource, it SHALL be referred to from elsewhere in the resource or SHALL refer to the containing resource
constraint.xpath: not(exists(for $resource in . return (for $contained in $resource/f:contained return $contained[not(descendant::f:*/@value='#' or (exists(f:id) and $resource//f:*/@*=concat('#', $contained/*/f:id/@value)))])))

constraint.human: If a resource is contained in another resource, it SHALL NOT have a meta.versionId or a meta.lastUpdated
If a resource is contained in another resource, it SHALL NOT have a security label

extension.valueMarkdown: When a resource has no narrative, only systems that fully understand the data can display the resource to a human safely. Including a human readable representation in the resource makes for a much more robust eco-system and cheaper handling of resources by intermediary systems. Some ecosystems restrict distribution of resources to only those systems that do fully understand the resources, and as a consequence implementers may believe that the narrative is superfluous. However experience shows that such eco-systems often open up to new participants over time.

constraint.human: A resource should have narrative for robust management

element.definition: An ingredient of a manufactured item or pharmaceutical product.
element.short: An ingredient of a manufactured item or pharmaceutical product

element.comment: The only time that a resource does not have an id is when it is being submitted to the server using a create operation.
element.definition: The logical id of the resource, as used in the URL for the resource. Once assigned, this value never changes.
element.short: Logical id of this artifact

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.definition: The metadata about the resource. This is content that is maintained by the infrastructure. Changes to the content might not always be associated with version changes to the resource.
element.short: Metadata about the resource

element.comment: Asserting this rule set restricts the content to be only understood by a limited set of trading partners. This inherently limits the usefulness of the data in the long term. However, the existing health eco-system is highly fractured, and not yet ready to define, collect, and exchange data in a generally computable sense. Wherever possible, implementers and/or specification writers should avoid using this element. Often, when used, the URL is a reference to an implementation guide that defines these special rules as part of it's narrative along with other profiles, value sets, etc.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.definition: A reference to a set of rules that were followed when the resource was constructed, and which must be understood when processing the content. Often, this is a reference to an implementation guide that defines the special rules along with other profiles etc.
element.isModifierReason: This element is labeled as a modifier because the implicit rules may provide additional knowledge about the resource that modifies it's meaning or interpretation
element.short: A set of rules under which this content was created

element.comment: Language is provided to support indexing and accessibility (typically, services such as text to speech use the language tag). The html language tag in the narrative applies  to the narrative. The language tag on the resource may be used to specify the language of other presentations generated from the data in the resource. Not all the content has to be in the base language. The Resource.language should not be assumed to apply to the narrative automatically. If a language is specified, it should it also be specified on the div element in the html (see rules in HTML5 for information about the relationship between xml:lang and the html lang attribute).

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.definition: The base language in which the resource is written.
element.short: Language of the resource content

element.comment: Contained resources do not have narrative. Resources that are not contained SHOULD have a narrative. In some cases, a resource may only have text with little or no additional discrete data (as long as all minOccurs=1 elements are satisfied).  This may be necessary for data from legacy systems where information is captured as a "text blob" or where text is additionally entered raw or narrated and encoded information is added later.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.definition: A human-readable narrative that contains a summary of the resource and can be used to represent the content of the resource to a human. The narrative need not encode all the structured data, but is required to contain sufficient detail to make it "clinically safe" for a human to just read the narrative. Resource definitions may define what content should be represented in the narrative to ensure clinical safety.
element.short: Text summary of the resource, for human interpretation

element.comment: This should never be done when the content can be identified properly, as once identification is lost, it is extremely difficult (and context dependent) to restore it again. Contained resources may have profiles and tags In their meta elements, but SHALL NOT have security labels.
element.definition: These resources do not have an independent existence apart from the resource that contains them - they cannot be identified independently, and nor can they have their own independent transaction scope.
element.short: Contained, inline Resources

element.comment: There can be no stigma associated with the use of extensions by any application, project, or standard - regardless of the institution or jurisdiction that uses or defines the extensions.  The use of extensions is what allows the FHIR specification to retain a core level of simplicity for everyone.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children
Must have either extensions or value[x], not both

To make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict set of governance  applied to the definition and use of extensions. element.definition:
May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the resource and that modifies the understanding of the element that contains it and/or the understanding of the containing element's descendants. Usually modifier elements provide negation or qualification. To make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict set of governance applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer is allowed to define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension. Applications processing a resource are required to check for modifier extensions.

Modifier extensions SHALL NOT change the meaning of any elements on Resource or DomainResource (including cannot change the meaning of modifierExtension itself).
element.isModifierReason: Modifier extensions are expected to modify the meaning or interpretation of the resource that contains them
element.requirements: Modifier extensions allow for extensions that *cannot* be safely ignored to be clearly distinguished from the vast majority of extensions which can be safely ignored.  This promotes interoperability by eliminating the need for implementers to prohibit the presence of extensions. For further information, see the [definition of modifier extensions](extensibility.html#modifierExtension).

text.div:
NameFlagsCard.TypeDescription & Constraints
Ingredient TUDomainResourceAn ingredient of a manufactured item or pharmaceutical product
Elements defined in Ancestors: id, meta, implicitRules, language, text, contained, extension, modifierExtension
identifier 0..1IdentifierAn identifier or code by which the ingredient can be referenced
role 1..1CodeableConceptA classification of the ingredient identifying its purpose within the product, e.g. active, inactive
function 0..*CodeableConceptA classification of the ingredient identifying its precise purpose(s) in the drug product. This extends the Ingredient.role to add more detail. Example: Antioxidant, Alkalizing Agent
description 0..1markdownA general description of the ingredient, or any supporting text. May be used for an unstructured list of excipients
allergenicIndicator 0..1booleanIf the ingredient is a known or suspected allergen
manufacturer 0..*Reference(Organization)The organization that manufactures this ingredient
substance 0..1BackboneElementThe substance that comprises this ingredient
code 1..1CodeableReference(SubstanceDefinition | Substance)A code or full resource that represents the ingredient substance
strength 0..*BackboneElementThe quantity of substance in the unit of presentation, or in the volume (or mass) of the single pharmaceutical product or manufactured item. When there is a range of strengths, this represents the lower limit
presentation 0..1RatioThe quantity of substance in the unit of presentation, or in the volume (or mass) of the single pharmaceutical product or manufactured item
presentationHighLimit ?!0..1RatioAn upper limit for the quantity of substance in the unit of presentation. When there is a range of strengths, this represents the upper limit
presentationText 0..1stringA textual represention of either the whole of the presentation strength or a part of it - with the rest being in Strength.presentation as a ratio
concentration 0..1RatioThe strength per unitary volume (or mass)
concentrationHighLimit ?!0..1RatioAn upper limit for the strength per unitary volume (or mass), for when there is a range. The concentration attribute then becomes the lower limit
concentrationText 0..1stringA textual represention of either the whole of the concentration strength or a part of it - with the rest being in Strength.concentration as a ratio
measurementPoint 0..1stringFor when strength is measured at a particular point or distance
country 0..*CodeableConceptThe country or countries for which the strength range applies
referenceStrength 0..*BackboneElementStrength expressed in terms of a reference substance
substance 0..1CodeableReference(SubstanceDefinition | Substance)Relevant reference substance
strength 1..1RatioStrength expressed in terms of a reference substance. When there is a range of strengths, this represents the lower limit
strengthHighLimit 0..1RatioStrength expressed in terms of a reference substance. When there is a range of strengths, this represents the upper limit
measurementPoint 0..1stringFor when strength is measured at a particular point or distance
country 0..*CodeableConceptThe country or countries for which the strength range applies
specifiedSubstance 0..*BackboneElementA specified substance that comprises this ingredient
code 1..1CodeableReference(SubstanceDefinition | Substance)Substance as a 'specified substance', implying extra substance related characteristics
group 1..1CodeableConceptThe group of specified substance, e.g. group 1 to 4, where the group categorises the level of description of the substance according to standardised sets of properties
confidentiality 0..1CodeableConceptConfidentiality level of the specified substance as the ingredient
strength 0..*see strengthQuantity of the substance or specified substance present in the manufactured item or pharmaceutical product

Documentation for this format
